instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v, no power
threads.message: Hey guys, board is clean, no corrosion, board stuck every 4 ports 5.07 and 10ma. ppbus is 1v ? where to start.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v, no power
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> first.
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> gets 5V?
If yes, porst <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v, no power
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> gets 19.9v, and now got board to 20v and ppbus jumping 12.3-12.64 board, and no boot, no cpu acitivity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v, no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v, no power
threads.message:
AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are stable?
Check what happens connecting both charger and battery.
